title: Tensor.Scatter_ misleading error message
body_html:
>>> torch.zeros(3, 4).scatter_(0, torch.LongTensor([[2, 2, 2],[1, 1,1],[0, 0,0]]), torch.arange(1,13).resize_(3, 4))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Expected tensor [3 x 4], src [3 x 4] and index [3 x 3] to have the same size in dimension 0 at /Users/soumith/miniconda2/conda-bld/pytorch_1502000975045/work/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensorMath.c:470

src and index do in fact have the same size in dimension 0 (both are 3). They should have the same size in dimension 1.
This works fine:
torch.zeros(3, 4).scatter_(0, torch.LongTensor([[2, 2, 2, 2],[1, 1,1,1],[0, 0,0,0]]), torch.arange(1,13).resize_(3, 4))
